name: nmdc_submission_schema
description: Schema for creating Data Harmonizer interfaces for biosamples based on MIxS and other standards

checklist.name: checklist
checklist.description: A MIxS checklist. These can be combined with packages

package.name: package
package.description: A MIxS package. These can be combined with checklists

checklist_package_combination.name: checklist_package_combination
checklist_package_combination.description: A combination of a checklist and a package

sample subset.name: sample subset
sample subset.description: Subset consisting of entities linked to the processing of samples.  Currently, this subset consists of study, omics process, and biosample.

data object subset.name: data object subset
data object subset.description: Subset consisting of the data objects that either inputs or outputs of processes or workflows.

workflow subset.name: workflow subset
workflow subset.description: Subset consisting of just the workflow execution activities

unit.name: unit
todos: why isn't this picked up from the nmdc.yaml import?

notes: I don't think this is a MIxS term anymore, so it make sense to define it here
string range according to MIxS
see samp_store_dur, samp_store_loc, samp_store_temp and store_cond (which takes a string range according to mixs-source).

site context (adjacent buildings, vegeta.text: site context (adjacent buildings, vegetation, terrain, streets)

active surveillance in response to an ou.text: active surveillance in response to an outbreak

active surveillance not initiated by an.text: active surveillance not initiated by an outbreak

rainforest (evergreen forest receiving g.text: rainforest (evergreen forest receiving greater than 406 cm annual rainfall)

swamp (permanent or semi-permanent water.text: swamp (permanent or semi-permanent water body dominated by woody plants)

EMSL_store_temp.name: EMSL_store_temp
EMSL_store_temp.description: Temperature at which the sample sent to EMSL should be stored
EMSL_store_temp.title: EMSL sample storage temperature, deg. C
comments: Enter a temperature in celsius. Numeric portion only.

analysis_type.name: analysis_type
analysis_type.description: Select all the data types associated or available for this biosample
analysis_type.title: analysis/data type

collection_date_inc.name: collection_date_inc
collection_date_inc.description: Date the incubation was harvested/collected/ended. Only relevant for incubation samples.
collection_date_inc.title: incubation collection date
notes: MIxS collection_date accepts (truncated) ISO8601. DH taking arb prec date only
comments: Date should be formatted as YYYY(-MM(-DD)). Ie, 2021-04-15, 2021-04 and 2021 are all acceptable.

collection_time.name: collection_time
collection_time.description: The time of sampling, either as an instance (single point) or interval.
collection_time.title: collection time, GMT
notes: MIxS collection_date accepts (truncated) ISO8601. DH taking seconds optional time only
comments: Time should be entered as HH:MM(:SS) in GMT. See here for a converter: https://www.worldtimebuddy.com/pst-to-gmt-converter

collection_time_inc.name: collection_time_inc
collection_time_inc.description: Time the incubation was harvested/collected/ended. Only relevant for incubation samples.
collection_time_inc.title: incubation collection time, GMT
notes: MIxS collection_date accepts (truncated) ISO8601. DH taking seconds optional time only
comments: Time should be entered as HH:MM(:SS) in GMT. See here for a converter: https://www.worldtimebuddy.com/pst-to-gmt-converter

dh_section.name: dh_section
dh_section.description: A section (ie group if columns) within a DataHarmonizer interface

dna_absorb1.name: dna_absorb1
dna_absorb1.title: DNA absorbance 260/280
comments: Recommended value is between 1 and 3.

dna_absorb2.name: dna_absorb2
dna_absorb2.title: DNA absorbance 260/230
comments: Recommended value is between 1 and 3.

dna_collect_site.name: dna_collect_site
dna_collect_site.description: Provide information on the site your DNA sample was collected from
dna_collect_site.title: DNA collection site

dna_concentration.name: dna_concentration
dna_concentration.title: DNA concentration in ng/ul
comments: Units must be in ng/uL. Enter the numerical part only. Must be calculated using a fluorometric method. Acceptable values are 0-2000.

dna_container_ID.name: dna_container_ID
dna_container_ID.title: DNA container label
comments: Must be unique across all tubes and plates, and <20 characters. All samples in a plate should have the same plate label.

dna_dnase.name: dna_dnase
dna_dnase.title: DNase treatment DNA
comments: Note DNAse treatment is required for all RNA samples.

dna_isolate_meth.name: dna_isolate_meth
dna_isolate_meth.description: Describe the method/protocol/kit used to extract DNA/RNA.
dna_isolate_meth.title: DNA isolation method

dna_organisms.name: dna_organisms
dna_organisms.description: List any organisms known or suspected to grow in co-culture, as well as estimated % of the organism in that culture.
dna_organisms.title: DNA expected organisms

examples.value: expected to contain microbes (59%) fungi (30%), viruses (10%), tadpoles (1%)

dna_project_contact.name: dna_project_contact
dna_project_contact.title: DNA seq project contact
comments: Do not edit these values. A template will be provided by NMDC in which these values have been pre-filled.

dna_samp_ID.name: dna_samp_ID
dna_samp_ID.title: DNA sample ID
todos: Removed identifier = TRUE from dna_samp_ID in JGI_sample_slots, as a class can't have two identifiers. How to force uniqueness? Moot because that column will be prefilled?
comments: Do not edit these values. A template will be provided by NMDC in which these values have been pre-filled.

dna_sample_format.name: dna_sample_format
dna_sample_format.description: Solution in which the DNA sample has been suspended
dna_sample_format.title: DNA sample format

dna_sample_name.name: dna_sample_name
dna_sample_name.description: Give the DNA sample a name that is meaningful to you. Sample names must be unique across all JGI projects and contain a-z, A-Z, 0-9, - and _ only.
dna_sample_name.title: DNA sample name

dna_seq_project.name: dna_seq_project
dna_seq_project.title: DNA seq project ID
comments: Do not edit these values. A template will be provided by NMDC in which these values have been pre-filled.

dna_seq_project_PI.name: dna_seq_project_PI
dna_seq_project_PI.title: DNA seq project PI
comments: Do not edit these values. A template will be provided by NMDC in which these values have been pre-filled.

dna_seq_project_name.name: dna_seq_project_name
dna_seq_project_name.title: DNA seq project name
comments: Do not edit these values. A template will be provided by NMDC in which these values have been pre-filled.

dna_volume.name: dna_volume
dna_volume.title: DNA volume in ul
comments: Units must be in uL. Enter the numerical part only. Value must 0-1000. Values <25 by special permission only.

dnase_rna.name: dnase_rna
dnase_rna.title: DNase treated
comments: Note DNAse treatment is required for all RNA samples.

env_package.name: env_package
env_package.description: Select the MIxS enviromental package that best describes the environment from which your sample was collected.
env_package.title: environmental package

experimental_factor_other.name: experimental_factor_other
experimental_factor_other.description: Other details about your sample that you feel can't be accurately represented in the available columns.
experimental_factor_other.title: experimental factor- other

filter_method.name: filter_method
filter_method.description: Type of filter used or how the sample was filtered
filter_method.title: filter method

isotope_exposure.name: isotope_exposure
isotope_exposure.description: List isotope exposure or addition applied to your sample.
isotope_exposure.title: isotope exposure/addition

micro_biomass_C_meth.name: micro_biomass_C_meth
micro_biomass_C_meth.description: Reference or method used in determining microbial biomass
micro_biomass_C_meth.title: microbial biomass carbon method
comments: required if "microbial_biomass_C" is provided

micro_biomass_N_meth.name: micro_biomass_N_meth
micro_biomass_N_meth.description: Reference or method used in determining microbial biomass nitrogen
micro_biomass_N_meth.title: microbial biomass nitrogen method
comments: required if "microbial_biomass_N" is provided

microbial_biomass_C.name: microbial_biomass_C
microbial_biomass_C.description: The part of the organic matter in the soil that constitutes living microorganisms smaller than 5-10 micrometer. If you keep this, you would need to have correction factors used for conversion to the final units
microbial_biomass_C.title: microbial biomass carbon

microbial_biomass_N.name: microbial_biomass_N
microbial_biomass_N.description: The part of the organic matter in the soil that constitutes living microorganisms smaller than 5-10 micrometer. If you keep this, you would need to have correction factors used for conversion to the final units
microbial_biomass_N.title: microbial biomass nitrogen

non_microb_biomass.name: non_microb_biomass
non_microb_biomass.description: Amount of biomass; should include the name for the part of biomass measured, e.g.insect, plant, total. Can include multiple measurements separated by ;
non_microb_biomass.title: non-microbial biomass

non_microb_biomass_method.name: non_microb_biomass_method
non_microb_biomass_method.description: Reference or method used in determining biomass
non_microb_biomass_method.title: non-microbial biomass method
comments: required if "non-microbial biomass" is provided

org_nitro_method.name: org_nitro_method
org_nitro_method.description: Method used for obtaining organic nitrogen
org_nitro_method.title: organic nitrogen method
comments: required if "org_nitro" is provided

other_treatment.name: other_treatment
other_treatment.description: Other treatments applied to your samples that are not applicable to the provided fields
other_treatment.title: other treatments

project_ID.description: Proposal IDs or names associated with dataset
project_ID.title: project ID

proposal_dna.title: DNA proposal ID

sample_link.name: sample_link
sample_link.description: A unique identifier to assign parent-child, subsample, or sibling samples. This is relevant when a sample or other material was used to generate the new sample.
sample_link.title: sample linkage
comments: This field allows multiple entries separated by ; (Examples: Soil collected from the field will link with the soil used in an incubation. The soil a plant was grown in links to the plant sample. An original culture sample was transferred to a new vial and generated a new sample)

sample_shipped.name: sample_shipped
sample_shipped.description: The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample sent to EMSL
sample_shipped.title: sample shipped amount

sample_type.name: sample_type
sample_type.title: sample type
comments: This can vary from 'environmental package' if the sample is an extraction.

start_date_inc.name: start_date_inc
start_date_inc.description: Date the incubation was started. Only relevant for incubation samples.
start_date_inc.title: incubation start date
notes: MIxS collection_date accepts (truncated) ISO8601. DH taking arb prec date only
comments: Date should be formatted as YYYY(-MM(-DD)). Ie, 2021-04-15, 2021-04 and 2021 are all acceptable.

air particulate matter concentration.name: air particulate matter concentration
air particulate matter concentration.description: Concentration of substances that remain suspended in the air, and comprise mixtures of organic and inorganic substances (PM10 and PM2.5); can report multiple PM's by entering numeric values preceded by name of PM
air particulate matter concentration.title: air_PM_concen

barometric_press.name: barometric_press
barometric_press.description: Force per unit area exerted against a surface by the weight of air above that surface
barometric_press.title: barometric pressure

carb_monoxide.name: carb_monoxide

preferred_unit.value: micromole per liter, parts per million

carb_monoxide.description: Carbon monoxide (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling
carb_monoxide.title: carbon monoxide

humidity.name: humidity
humidity.description: Amount of water vapour in the air, at the time of sampling
humidity.title: humidity

oxygen.name: oxygen

preferred_unit.value: milligram per liter, parts per million

oxygen.description: Oxygen (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling
oxygen.title: oxygen

pollutants.name: pollutants

preferred_unit.value: gram, mole per liter, milligram per liter, microgram per cubic meter

pollutants.description: Pollutant types and, amount or concentrations measured at the time of sampling; can report multiple pollutants by entering numeric values preceded by name of pollutant
pollutants.title: pollutants

solar_irradiance.name: solar_irradiance

preferred_unit.value: kilowatts per square meter per day, ergs per square centimeter per second

solar_irradiance.description: The amount of solar energy that arrives at a specific area of a surface during a specific time interval
solar_irradiance.title: solar irradiance

examples.value: 1.36 kilowatts per square meter per day

ventilation_rate.name: ventilation_rate

preferred_unit.value: cubic meter per minute, liters per second

ventilation_rate.description: Ventilation rate of the system in the sampled premises
ventilation_rate.title: ventilation rate

volatile_org_comp.name: volatile_org_comp

preferred_unit.value: microgram per cubic meter, parts per million, nanogram per liter

volatile_org_comp.description: Concentration of carbon-based chemicals that easily evaporate at room temperature; can report multiple volatile organic compounds by entering numeric values preceded by name of compound
volatile_org_comp.title: volatile organic compounds

wind_direction.name: wind_direction
wind_direction.description: Wind direction is the direction from which a wind originates
wind_direction.title: wind direction

wind_speed.name: wind_speed

preferred_unit.value: meter per second, kilometer per hour

wind_speed.description: Speed of wind measured at the time of sampling
wind_speed.title: wind speed

abs_air_humidity.name: abs_air_humidity

preferred_unit.value: gram per gram, kilogram per kilogram, kilogram, pound

abs_air_humidity.description: Actual mass of water vapor - mh20 - present in the air water vapor mixture
abs_air_humidity.title: absolute air humidity

address.name: address
address.description: The street name and building number where the sampling occurred.
address.title: address

adj_room.name: adj_room
adj_room.description: List of rooms (room number, room name) immediately adjacent to the sampling room
adj_room.title: adjacent rooms

aero_struc.name: aero_struc

aero_struc.title: aerospace structure

air_temp.name: air_temp
air_temp.description: Temperature of the air at the time of sampling
air_temp.title: air temperature

amount_light.name: amount_light

amount_light.title: amount of light

avg_temp.title: average temperature

bathroom_count.name: bathroom_count
bathroom_count.description: The number of bathrooms in the building

permeability.title: permeability

samp_md.name: samp_md
samp_md.description: In non deviated well, measured depth is equal to the true vertical depth, TVD (TVD=TVDSS plus the reference or datum it refers to). In deviated wells, the MD is the length of trajectory of the borehole measured from the same reference or datum. Common datums used are ground level (GL), drilling rig floor (DF), rotary table (RT), kelly bushing (KB) and mean sea level (MSL). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
samp_md.title: sample measured depth

samp_tvdss.name: samp_tvdss

expected_value.value: measurement value or measurement value range

samp_tvdss.description: Depth of the sample i.e. The vertical distance between the sea level and the sampled position in the subsurface. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples e.g. 1325.75-1362.25 m
samp_tvdss.title: sample true vertical depth subsea

sr_dep_env.name: sr_dep_env

sr_dep_env.title: source rock depositional environment

sr_geol_age.name: sr_geol_age
sr_geol_age.description: Geological age of source rock (Additional info: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Period_(geology)). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
sr_geol_age.title: source rock geological age

sr_kerog_type.name: sr_kerog_type
sr_kerog_type.description: Origin of kerogen. Type I: Algal (aquatic), Type II: planktonic and soft plant material (aquatic or terrestrial), Type III: terrestrial woody/ fibrous plant material (terrestrial), Type IV: oxidized recycled woody debris (terrestrial) (additional information: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kerogen). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
sr_kerog_type.title: source rock kerogen type

add_recov_method.title: secondary and tertiary recovery methods and start date
aliases: secondary and tertiary recovery methods and start date

biocide_admin_method.name: biocide_admin_method
biocide_admin_method.description: Method of biocide administration (dose, frequency, duration, time elapsed between last biociding and sampling) (e.g. 150 mg/l; weekly; 4 hr; 3 days)

chem_treatment.name: chem_treatment
chem_treatment.description: List of chemical compounds administered upstream the sampling location where sampling occurred (e.g. Glycols, H2S scavenger, corrosion and scale inhibitors, demulsifiers, and other production chemicals etc.). The commercial name of the product and name of the supplier should be provided. The date of administration should also be included
chem_treatment.title: chemical treatment

iw_bt_date_well.name: iw_bt_date_well

prod_rate.name: prod_rate
prod_rate.description: Oil and/or gas production rates per well (e.g. 524 m3 / day)
prod_rate.title: production rate

samp_collect_point.name: samp_collect_point
samp_collect_point.description: Sampling point on the asset were sample was collected (e.g. Wellhead, storage tank, separator, etc). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
samp_collect_point.title: sample collection point

samp_loc_corr_rate.name: samp_loc_corr_rate
samp_loc_corr_rate.description: Metal corrosion rate is the speed of metal deterioration due to environmental conditions. As environmental conditions change corrosion rates change accordingly. Therefore, long term corrosion rates are generally more informative than short term rates and for that reason they are preferred during reporting. In the case of suspected MIC, corrosion rate measurements at the time of sampling might provide insights into the involvement of certain microbial community members in MIC as well as potential microbial interplays
samp_loc_corr_rate.title: corrosion rate at sample location

samp_preserv.name: samp_preserv
samp_preserv.description: Preservative added to the sample (e.g. Rnalater, alcohol, formaldehyde, etc.). Where appropriate include volume added (e.g. Rnalater; 2 ml)
samp_preserv.title: preservative added to sample

water_prod_rate.name: water_prod_rate
water_prod_rate.description: Water production rates per well (e.g. 987 m3 / day)
water_prod_rate.title: water production rate

air_temp_regm.title: air temperature regimen

alkalinity.name: alkalinity

alkalinity.description: Alkalinity, the ability of a solution to neutralize acids to the equivalence point of carbonate or bicarbonate

alt.name: alt
alt.description: Altitude is a term used to identify heights of objects such as airplanes, space shuttles, rockets, atmospheric balloons and heights of places such as atmospheric layers and clouds. It is used to measure the height of an object which is above the earth's surface. In this context, the altitude measurement is the vertical distance between the earth's surface above sea level and the sampled position in the air
alt.title: altitude

ammonium.name: ammonium

ammonium.title: ammonium

aromatics_pc.name: aromatics_pc
aromatics_pc.description: Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene¬†(SARA) is an analysis method that divides¬†crude oil¬†components according to their polarizability and polarity. There are three main methods to obtain SARA results. The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene)
aromatics_pc.title: aromatics wt%

The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene)

collection_date.name: collection_date
collection_date.description: The time of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008; Except: 2008-01; 2008 all are ISO8601 compliant
collection_date.title: collection date

density.name: density

preferred_unit.value: gram per cubic meter, gram per cubic centimeter

density.description: Density of the sample, which is its mass per unit volume (aka volumetric mass density)
density.title: density

depos_env.name: depos_env
depos_env.description: Main depositional environment (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Depositional_environment). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
depos_env.title: depositional environment

depth.name: depth
depth.description: The vertical distance below local surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectively. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.
depth.title: depth

diether_lipids.name: diether_lipids
diether_lipids.description: Concentration of diether lipids; can include multiple types of diether lipids
diether_lipids.title: diether lipids

diss_carb_dioxide.name: diss_carb_dioxide

preferred_unit.value: micromole per liter, milligram per liter

diss_carb_dioxide.description: Concentration of dissolved carbon dioxide in the sample or liquid portion of the sample
diss_carb_dioxide.title: dissolved carbon dioxide

diss_inorg_carb.name: diss_inorg_carb

preferred_unit.value: microgram per liter, milligram per liter, parts per million

diss_inorg_carb.description: Dissolved inorganic carbon concentration in the sample, typically measured after filtering the sample using a 0.45 micrometer filter
diss_inorg_carb.title: dissolved inorganic carbon

diss_inorg_phosp.name: diss_inorg_phosp

preferred_unit.value: microgram per liter, milligram per liter, parts per million

diss_inorg_phosp.description: Concentration of dissolved inorganic phosphorus in the sample
diss_inorg_phosp.title: dissolved inorganic phosphorus

diss_iron.name: diss_iron
diss_iron.description: Concentration of dissolved iron in the sample
diss_iron.title: dissolved iron

diss_org_carb.name: diss_org_carb

preferred_unit.value: micromole per liter, milligram per liter

diss_org_carb.description: Concentration of dissolved organic carbon in the sample, liquid portion of the sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid
diss_org_carb.title: dissolved organic carbon

diss_org_nitro.name: diss_org_nitro

preferred_unit.value: microgram per liter, milligram per liter

diss_org_nitro.description: Dissolved organic nitrogen concentration measured as; total dissolved nitrogen - NH4 - NO3 - NO2
diss_org_nitro.title: dissolved organic nitrogen

preferred_unit.value: micromole per kilogram, milligram per liter

diss_oxygen_fluid.name: diss_oxygen_fluid

preferred_unit.value: micromole per kilogram, milligram per liter

diss_oxygen_fluid.description: Concentration of dissolved oxygen in the oil field produced fluids as it contributes to oxgen-corrosion and microbial activity (e.g. Mic).
diss_oxygen_fluid.title: dissolved oxygen in fluids

elev.name: elev
elev.description: Elevation of the sampling site is its height above a fixed reference point, most commonly the mean sea level. Elevation is mainly used when referring to points on the earth's surface, while altitude is used for points above the surface, such as an aircraft in flight or a spacecraft in orbit.
elev.title: elevation

env_broad_scale.name: env_broad_scale

expected_value.value: The major environment type(s) where the sample was collected. Recommend subclasses of biome [ENVO:00000428]. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes.

env_broad_scale.description: Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). We recommend using subclasses of EnvO’s biome class:  http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS
env_broad_scale.title: broad-scale environmental context

examples.value: oceanic epipelagic zone biome [ENVO:01000033] for annotating a water sample from the photic zone in middle of the Atlantic Ocean

env_local_scale.name: env_local_scale

expected_value.value: Environmental entities having causal influences upon the entity at time of sampling.

env_local_scale.description: Report the entity or entities which are in the sample or specimen’s local vicinity and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. We recommend using EnvO terms which are of smaller spatial grain than your entry for env_broad_scale. Terms, such as anatomical sites, from other OBO Library ontologies which interoperate with EnvO (e.g. UBERON) are accepted in this field. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.
env_local_scale.title: local environmental context

examples.value: litter layer [ENVO:01000338]; Annotating a pooled sample taken from various vegetation layers in a forest consider: canopy [ENVO:00000047]|herb and fern layer [ENVO:01000337]|litter layer [ENVO:01000338]|understory [01000335]|shrub layer [ENVO:01000336].

env_medium.name: env_medium

expected_value.value: The material displaced by the entity at time of sampling. Recommend subclasses of environmental material [ENVO:00010483].

env_medium.description: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).
env_medium.title: environmental medium

examples.value: soil [ENVO:00001998]; Annotating a fish swimming in the upper 100 m of the Atlantic Ocean, consider: ocean water [ENVO:00002151]. Example: Annotating a duck on a pond consider: pond water [ENVO:00002228]|air [ENVO_00002005]

ethylbenzene.name: ethylbenzene

preferred_unit.value: milligram per liter, parts per million

ethylbenzene.description: Concentration of ethylbenzene in the sample
ethylbenzene.title: ethylbenzene

experimental_factor.name: experimental_factor
experimental_factor.description: Experimental factors are essentially the variable aspects of an experiment design which can be used to describe an experiment, or set of experiments, in an increasingly detailed manner. This field accepts ontology terms from Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO) and/or Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI). For a browser of EFO (v 2.95) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/EFO; for a browser of OBI (v 2018-02-12) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI
experimental_factor.title: experimental factor

field.name: field
field.description: Name of the hydrocarbon field (e.g. Albacora)
field.title: field name

gaseous_environment.name: gaseous_environment

expected_value.value: gaseous compound name;gaseous compound amount;treatment interval and duration

gaseous_environment.description: Use of conditions with differing gaseous environments; should include the name of gaseous compound, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple gaseous environment regimens
gaseous_environment.title: gaseous environment

genetic_mod.name: genetic_mod
genetic_mod.description: Genetic modifications of the genome of an organism, which may occur naturally by spontaneous mutation, or be introduced by some experimental means, e.g. specification of a transgene or the gene knocked-out or details of transient transfection
genetic_mod.title: genetic modification

geo_loc_name.name: geo_loc_name

expected_value.value: country or sea name (INSDC or GAZ): region(GAZ), specific location name

geo_loc_name.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea name followed by specific region name. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html), or the GAZ ontology (http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/GAZ)
geo_loc_name.title: geographic location (country and/or sea,region)

growth_facil.name: growth_facil
growth_facil.description: Type of facility where the sampled plant was grown; controlled vocabulary: growth chamber, open top chamber, glasshouse, experimental garden, field. Alternatively use Crop Ontology (CO) terms, see http://www.cropontology.org/ontology/CO_715/Crop%20Research
growth_facil.title: growth facility

hc_produced.name: hc_produced
hc_produced.description: Main hydrocarbon type produced from resource (i.e. Oil, gas, condensate, etc). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
hc_produced.title: hydrocarbon type produced

hcr.name: hcr
hcr.description: Main Hydrocarbon Resource type. The term "Hydrocarbon Resource" HCR defined as a natural environmental feature containing large amounts of hydrocarbons at high concentrations potentially suitable for commercial exploitation. This term should not be confused with the Hydrocarbon Occurrence term which also includes hydrocarbon-rich environments with currently limited commercial interest such as seeps, outcrops, gas hydrates etc. If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
hcr.title: hydrocarbon resource type

hcr_fw_salinity.name: hcr_fw_salinity
hcr_fw_salinity.description: Original formation water salinity (prior to secondary recovery e.g. Waterflooding) expressed as TDS
hcr_fw_salinity.title: formation water salinity

hcr_geol_age.name: hcr_geol_age
hcr_geol_age.description: Geological age of hydrocarbon resource (Additional info: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Period_(geology)). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
hcr_geol_age.title: hydrocarbon resource geological age

hcr_pressure.name: hcr_pressure
hcr_pressure.description: Original pressure of the hydrocarbon resource
hcr_pressure.title: hydrocarbon resource original pressure

hcr_temp.name: hcr_temp
hcr_temp.description: Original temperature of the hydrocarbon resource
hcr_temp.title: hydrocarbon resource original temperature

host_age.name: host_age
host_age.description: Age of host at the time of sampling; relevant scale depends on species and study, e.g. Could be seconds for amoebae or centuries for trees
host_age.title: host age

host_life_stage.name: host_life_stage
host_life_stage.description: Description of life stage of host
host_life_stage.title: host life stage

host_phenotype.name: host_phenotype
host_phenotype.description: Phenotype of human or other host. For phenotypic quality ontology (pato) (v 2018-03-27) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/pato. For Human Phenotype Ontology (HP) (v 2018-06-13) please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/HP
host_phenotype.title: host phenotype

host_subspecf_genlin.name: host_subspecf_genlin

expected_value.value: Genetic lineage below lowest rank of NCBI taxonomy, which is subspecies, e.g. serovar, biotype, ecotype, variety, cultivar.

host_subspecf_genlin.description: Information about the genetic distinctness of the host organism below the subspecies level e.g., serovar, serotype, biotype, ecotype, variety, cultivar, or any relevant genetic typing schemes like Group I plasmid. Subspecies should not be recorded in this term, but in the NCBI taxonomy. Supply both the lineage name and the lineage rank separated by a colon, e.g., biovar:abc123.
host_subspecf_genlin.title: host subspecific genetic lineage

host_symbiont.name: host_symbiont
host_symbiont.description: The taxonomic name of the organism(s) found living in mutualistic, commensalistic, or parasitic symbiosis with the specific host.
host_symbiont.title: observed host symbionts

host_taxid.name: host_taxid
host_taxid.description: NCBI taxon id of the host, e.g. 9606
host_taxid.title: host taxid

host_tot_mass.name: host_tot_mass
host_tot_mass.description: Total mass of the host at collection, the unit depends on host
host_tot_mass.title: host total mass

humidity_regm.name: humidity_regm
humidity_regm.description: Information about treatment involving an exposure to varying degree of humidity; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include amount of humidity administered, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include multiple regimens
humidity_regm.title: humidity regimen

lat_lon.name: lat_lon

expected_value.value: decimal degrees,  limit to 8 decimal points

lat_lon.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude and longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system
lat_lon.title: geographic location (latitude and longitude)

light_regm.name: light_regm
light_regm.description: Information about treatment(s) involving exposure to light, including both light intensity and quality.
light_regm.title: light regimen

lithology.name: lithology
lithology.description: Hydrocarbon resource main lithology (Additional information: http://petrowiki.org/Lithology_and_rock_type_determination). If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
lithology.title: lithology

magnesium.name: magnesium

preferred_unit.value: mole per liter, milligram per liter, parts per million, micromole per kilogram

magnesium.description: Concentration of magnesium in the sample
magnesium.title: magnesium

mean_peak_frict_vel.name: mean_peak_frict_vel
mean_peak_frict_vel.description: Measurement of mean peak friction velocity
mean_peak_frict_vel.title: mean peak friction velocity

methane.name: methane

preferred_unit.value: micromole per liter, parts per billion, parts per million

methane.description: Methane (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling
methane.title: methane

misc_param.name: misc_param
misc_param.description: Any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here
misc_param.title: miscellaneous parameter

examples.value: Bicarbonate ion concentration;2075 micromole per kilogram

n_alkanes.name: n_alkanes
n_alkanes.description: Concentration of n-alkanes; can include multiple n-alkanes
n_alkanes.title: n-alkanes

nitrate.name: nitrate

preferred_unit.value: micromole per liter, milligram per liter, parts per million

nitrate.description: Concentration of nitrate in the sample
nitrate.title: nitrate

nitrite.name: nitrite

preferred_unit.value: micromole per liter, milligram per liter, parts per million

nitrite.description: Concentration of nitrite in the sample
nitrite.title: nitrite

org_count_qpcr_info.name: org_count_qpcr_info

expected_value.value: gene name;FWD:forward primer sequence;REV:reverse primer sequence;initial denaturation:degrees_minutes;denaturation:degrees_minutes;annealing:degrees_minutes;elongation:degrees_minutes;final elongation:degrees_minutes; total cycles

preferred_unit.value: number of cells per gram (or ml or cm^2)

org_count_qpcr_info.description: If qpcr was used for the cell count, the target gene name, the primer sequence and the cycling conditions should also be provided. (Example: 16S rrna; FWD:ACGTAGCTATGACGT REV:GTGCTAGTCGAGTAC; initial denaturation:90C_5min; denaturation:90C_2min; annealing:52C_30 sec; elongation:72C_30 sec; 90 C for 1 min; final elongation:72C_5min; 30 cycles)
org_count_qpcr_info.title: organism count qPCR information

organism_count.name: organism_count

preferred_unit.value: number of cells per cubic meter, number of cells per milliliter, number of cells per cubic centimeter

organism_count.description: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) Should also be provided. (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qpcr)
organism_count.title: organism count

perturbation.name: perturbation

expected_value.value: perturbation type name;perturbation interval and duration

perturbation.description: Type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with perturbation regimen including how many times the perturbation was repeated, how long each perturbation lasted, and the start and end time of the entire perturbation period; can include multiple perturbation types
perturbation.title: perturbation

ph.name: ph
ph.description: Ph measurement of the sample, or liquid portion of sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid
ph.title: pH

phaeopigments.name: phaeopigments
phaeopigments.description: Concentration of phaeopigments; can include multiple phaeopigments
phaeopigments.title: phaeopigments

phosplipid_fatt_acid.name: phosplipid_fatt_acid

preferred_unit.value: mole per gram, mole per liter

phosplipid_fatt_acid.description: Concentration of phospholipid fatty acids; can include multiple values
phosplipid_fatt_acid.title: phospholipid fatty acid

porosity.name: porosity
porosity.description: Porosity of deposited sediment is volume of voids divided by the total volume of sample
porosity.title: porosity

potassium.name: potassium

preferred_unit.value: milligram per liter, parts per million

potassium.description: Concentration of potassium in the sample
potassium.title: potassium

pour_point.name: pour_point
pour_point.description: Temperature at which a liquid becomes semi solid and loses its flow characteristics. In crude oil a high¬†pour point¬†is generally associated with a high paraffin content, typically found in crude deriving from a larger proportion of plant material. (soure: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/pour_point)
pour_point.title: pour point

pressure.name: pressure
pressure.description: Pressure to which the sample is subject to, in atmospheres
pressure.title: pressure

redox_potential.name: redox_potential
redox_potential.description: Redox potential, measured relative to a hydrogen cell, indicating oxidation or reduction potential
redox_potential.title: redox potential

rel_to_oxygen.name: rel_to_oxygen
rel_to_oxygen.description: Is this organism an aerobe, anaerobe? Please note that aerobic and anaerobic are valid descriptors for microbial environments
rel_to_oxygen.title: relationship to oxygen

resins_pc.name: resins_pc
resins_pc.description: Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene¬†(SARA) is an analysis method that divides¬†crude oil¬†components according to their polarizability and polarity. There are three main methods to obtain SARA results. The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene)
resins_pc.title: resins wt%

salinity.name: salinity
salinity.description: The total concentration of all dissolved salts in a liquid or solid sample. While salinity can be measured by a complete chemical analysis, this method is difficult and time consuming. More often, it is instead derived from the conductivity measurement. This is known as practical salinity. These derivations compare the specific conductance of the sample to a salinity standard such as seawater.
salinity.title: salinity

samp_collec_device.name: samp_collec_device
samp_collec_device.description: The device used to collect an environmental sample. This field accepts terms listed under environmental sampling device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO). This field also accepts terms listed under specimen collection device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0002094).
samp_collec_device.title: sample collection device

examples.value: swab, biopsy, niskin bottle, push core, drag swab [GENEPIO:0002713]

samp_collec_method.name: samp_collec_method
samp_collec_method.description: The method employed for collecting the sample.
samp_collec_method.title: sample collection method

samp_dis_stage.name: samp_dis_stage
samp_dis_stage.description: Stage of the disease at the time of sample collection, e.g. inoculation, penetration, infection, growth and reproduction, dissemination of pathogen.
samp_dis_stage.title: sample disease stage

samp_mat_process.name: samp_mat_process
samp_mat_process.description: A brief description of any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment, or a link to the relevant protocol(s) performed.
samp_mat_process.title: sample material processing

examples.value: filtering of seawater, storing samples in ethanol

samp_name.name: samp_name
samp_name.description: A local identifier or name that for the material sample used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. It can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. It can have any format, but we suggest that you make it concise, unique and consistent within your lab, and as informative as possible. INSDC requires every sample name from a single Submitter to be unique. Use of a globally unique identifier for the field source_mat_id is recommended in addition to sample_name.
samp_name.title: sample name

samp_size.name: samp_size
samp_size.description: The total amount or size (volume (ml), mass (g) or area (m2) ) of sample collected.
samp_size.title: amount or size of sample collected
aliases: amount or size of sample collected

samp_store_dur.name: samp_store_dur
samp_store_dur.description: Duration for which the sample was stored
samp_store_dur.title: sample storage duration

samp_store_loc.name: samp_store_loc
samp_store_loc.description: Location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room
samp_store_loc.title: sample storage location

samp_store_temp.name: samp_store_temp
samp_store_temp.description: Temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80 degree Celsius
samp_store_temp.title: sample storage temperature

samp_subtype.name: samp_subtype
samp_subtype.description: Name of sample sub-type. For example if "sample type" is "Produced Water" then subtype could be "Oil Phase" or "Water Phase". If "other" is specified, please propose entry in "additional info" field
samp_subtype.title: sample subtype

samp_transport_cond.name: samp_transport_cond
samp_transport_cond.description: Sample transport duration (in days or hrs) and temperature the sample was exposed to (e.g. 5.5 days; 20 ¬∞C)
samp_transport_cond.title: sample transport conditions

samp_type.name: samp_type
samp_type.description: The type of material from which the sample was obtained. For the Hydrocarbon package, samples include types like core, rock trimmings, drill cuttings, piping section, coupon, pigging debris, solid deposit, produced fluid, produced water, injected water, swabs, etc. For the Food Package, samples are usually categorized as food, body products or tissues, or environmental material. This field accepts terms listed under environmental specimen (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0001246).
samp_type.title: sample type

samp_well_name.name: samp_well_name
samp_well_name.description: Name of the well (e.g. BXA1123) where sample was taken
samp_well_name.title: sample well name

saturates_pc.name: saturates_pc
saturates_pc.description: Saturate, Aromatic, Resin and Asphaltene¬†(SARA) is an analysis method that divides¬†crude oil¬†components according to their polarizability and polarity. There are three main methods to obtain SARA results. The most popular one is known as the Iatroscan TLC-FID and is referred to as IP-143 (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saturate,_aromatic,_resin_and_asphaltene)
saturates_pc.title: saturates wt%

size_frac.name: size_frac
size_frac.description: Filtering pore size used in sample preparation
size_frac.title: size fraction selected

size_frac_low.name: size_frac_low
size_frac_low.description: Refers to the mesh/pore size used to pre-filter/pre-sort the sample. Materials larger than the size threshold are excluded from the sample
size_frac_low.title: size-fraction lower threshold

size_frac_up.name: size_frac_up
size_frac_up.description: Refers to the mesh/pore size used to retain the sample. Materials smaller than the size threshold are excluded from the sample
size_frac_up.title: size-fraction upper threshold

preferred_unit.value: milligram per liter, parts per million

source_mat_id.name: source_mat_id

expected_value.value: for cultures of microorganisms: identifiers for two culture collections; for other material a unique arbitrary identifer

source_mat_id.description: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample (as defined by http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/materialSampleID, and as opposed to a particular digital record of a material sample) used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. The INSDC qualifiers /specimen_voucher, /bio_material, or /culture_collection may or may not share the same value as the source_mat_id field. For instance, the /specimen_voucher qualifier and source_mat_id may both contain 'UAM:Herps:14' , referring to both the specimen voucher and sampled tissue with the same identifier. However, the /culture_collection qualifier may refer to a value from an initial culture (e.g. ATCC:11775) while source_mat_id would refer to an identifier from some derived culture from which the nucleic acids were extracted (e.g. xatc123 or ark:/2154/R2).
source_mat_id.title: source material identifiers

sulfate.name: sulfate

preferred_unit.value: micromole per liter, milligram per liter, parts per million

sulfate.description: Concentration of sulfate in the sample
sulfate.title: sulfate

sulfate_fw.name: sulfate_fw
sulfate_fw.description: Original sulfate concentration in the hydrocarbon resource
sulfate_fw.title: sulfate in formation water

sulfide.name: sulfide

preferred_unit.value: micromole per liter, milligram per liter, parts per million

sulfide.description: Concentration of sulfide in the sample
sulfide.title: sulfide

suspend_solids.name: suspend_solids

preferred_unit.value: gram, microgram, milligram per liter, mole per liter, gram per liter, part per million

suspend_solids.description: Concentration of substances including a wide variety of material, such as silt, decaying plant and animal matter; can include multiple substances
suspend_solids.title: suspended solids

tan.name: tan
tan.description: Total Acid Number¬†(TAN) is a measurement of acidity that is determined by the amount of¬†potassium hydroxide¬†in milligrams that is needed to neutralize the acids in one gram of oil.¬†It is an important quality measurement of¬†crude oil. (source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Total_acid_number)
tan.title: total acid number

temp.name: temp
temp.description: Temperature of the sample at the time of sampling.
temp.title: temperature

toluene.name: toluene

preferred_unit.value: milligram per liter, parts per million

toluene.description: Concentration of toluene in the sample
toluene.title: toluene

tot_depth_water_col.name: tot_depth_water_col
tot_depth_water_col.description: Measurement of total depth of water column
tot_depth_water_col.title: total depth of water column

tot_iron.name: tot_iron

preferred_unit.value: milligram per liter, milligram per kilogram

tot_iron.description: Concentration of total iron in the sample
tot_iron.title: total iron

tot_nitro.name: tot_nitro

preferred_unit.value: microgram per liter, micromole per liter, milligram per liter

tot_nitro.description: Total nitrogen concentration of water samples, calculated by: total nitrogen = total dissolved nitrogen + particulate nitrogen. Can also be measured without filtering, reported as nitrogen
tot_nitro.title: total nitrogen concentration

tot_nitro_content.name: tot_nitro_content

preferred_unit.value: microgram per liter, micromole per liter, milligram per liter

tot_nitro_content.description: Total nitrogen content of the sample
tot_nitro_content.title: total nitrogen content

tot_org_carb.name: tot_org_carb

preferred_unit.value: gram Carbon per kilogram sample material

tot_org_carb.description: Definition for soil: total organic carbon content of the soil, definition otherwise: total organic carbon content
tot_org_carb.title: total organic carbon

tot_phosp.name: tot_phosp

preferred_unit.value: micromole per liter, milligram per liter, parts per million

tot_phosp.description: Total phosphorus concentration in the sample, calculated by: total phosphorus = total dissolved phosphorus + particulate phosphorus
tot_phosp.title: total phosphorus

tot_sulfur.name: tot_sulfur

preferred_unit.value: milligram per liter, parts per million

tot_sulfur.description: Concentration of total sulfur in the sample
tot_sulfur.title: total sulfur

turbidity.name: turbidity

preferred_unit.value: formazin turbidity unit, formazin nephelometric units

turbidity.description: Measure of the amount of cloudiness or haziness in water caused by individual particles
turbidity.title: turbidity

tvdss_of_hcr_press.name: tvdss_of_hcr_press

fungicide_regm.title: fungicide regimen

Recommended value is a specific value from EO:plant growth medium (follow this link for terms http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/EO_0007147) or other controlled vocabulary

plant_product.description: Substance produced by the plant, where the sample was obtained from

This measure provides an indication of sun and wind exposure that will influence soil temperature and evapotranspiration.

soil_texture_meth.name: soil_texture_meth
soil_texture_meth.description: Reference or method used in determining soil texture

tot_org_c_meth.description: Reference or method used in determining total organic carbon

inorg_particles.name: inorg_particles

secondary_treatment.name: secondary_treatment

sewage_type.name: sewage_type
sewage_type.description: Type of wastewater treatment plant as municipial or industrial
sewage_type.title: sewage type

sludge_retent_time.name: sludge_retent_time
sludge_retent_time.description: The time activated sludge remains in reactor
sludge_retent_time.title: sludge retention time

soluble_inorg_mat.name: soluble_inorg_mat

preferred_unit.value: gram, microgram, mole per liter, gram per liter, parts per million

soluble_inorg_mat.description: Concentration of substances such as ammonia, road-salt, sea-salt, cyanide, hydrogen sulfide, thiocyanates, thiosulfates, etc.

soluble_org_mat.name: soluble_org_mat

tot_phosphate.name: tot_phosphate

number of photons per second per unit area

dna_cont_well.name: dna_cont_well
dna_cont_well.title: DNA plate position
comments: Required when 'plate' is selected for container type.
Leave blank if the sample will be shipped in a tube.
JGI will not process samples in corner wells, so A1, A12, H1 and H12 will not pass validation.
For partial plates, fill by columns, like B1-G1,A2-H2,A3-D3 (NOT A2-A11,B1-B8).

ammonium_nitrogen.name: ammonium_nitrogen
ammonium_nitrogen.description: Concentration of ammonium nitrogen in the sample
ammonium_nitrogen.title: ammonium nitrogen

ecosystem.name: ecosystem
ecosystem.description: An ecosystem is a combination of a physical environment (abiotic factors) and all the organisms (biotic factors) that interact with this environment. Ecosystem is in position 1/5 in a GOLD path.
comments: The abiotic factors play a profound role on the type and composition of organisms in a given environment. The GOLD Ecosystem at the top of the five-level classification system is aimed at capturing the broader environment from which an organism or environmental sample is collected. The three broad groups under Ecosystem are Environmental, Host-associated, and Engineered. They represent samples collected from a natural environment or from another organism or from engineered environments like bioreactors respectively.

ecosystem_category.name: ecosystem_category
ecosystem_category.description: Ecosystem categories represent divisions within the ecosystem based on specific characteristics of the environment from where an organism or sample is isolated. Ecosystem category is in position 2/5 in a GOLD path.
comments: The Environmental ecosystem (for example) is divided into Air, Aquatic and Terrestrial. Ecosystem categories for Host-associated samples can be individual hosts or phyla and for engineered samples it may be manipulated environments like bioreactors, solid waste etc.

ecosystem_subtype.name: ecosystem_subtype
ecosystem_subtype.description: Ecosystem subtypes represent further subdivision of Ecosystem types into more distinct subtypes. Ecosystem subtype is in position 4/5 in a GOLD path.
comments: Ecosystem Type Marine (Environmental -> Aquatic -> Marine) is further divided (for example) into Intertidal zone, Coastal, Pelagic, Intertidal zone etc. in the Ecosystem subtype category.

ecosystem_type.name: ecosystem_type
ecosystem_type.description: Ecosystem types represent things having common characteristics within the Ecosystem Category. These common characteristics based grouping is still broad but specific to the characteristics of a given environment. Ecosystem type is in position 3/5 in a GOLD path.
comments: The Aquatic ecosystem category (for example) may have ecosystem types like Marine or Thermal springs etc. Ecosystem category Air may have Indoor air or Outdoor air as different Ecosystem Types. In the case of Host-associated samples, ecosystem type can represent Respiratory system, Digestive system, Roots etc.

lbc_thirty.name: lbc_thirty
lbc_thirty.description: lime buffer capacity, determined after 30 minute incubation
lbc_thirty.title: lime buffer capacity (at 30 minutes)
comments: This is the mass of lime, in mg, needed to raise the pH of one kg of soil by one pH unit

lbceq.name: lbceq
lbceq.description: lime buffer capacity, determined at equilibrium after 5 day incubation
lbceq.title: lime buffer capacity (after 5 day incubation)
comments: This is the mass of lime, in mg, needed to raise the pH of one kg of soil by one pH unit

manganese.name: manganese
manganese.description: Concentration of manganese in the sample
manganese.title: manganese

nitrate_nitrogen.name: nitrate_nitrogen
nitrate_nitrogen.description: Concentration of nitrate nitrogen in the sample
nitrate_nitrogen.title: nitrate_nitrogen
comments: often below some specified limit of detection

nitrite_nitrogen.name: nitrite_nitrogen
nitrite_nitrogen.description: Concentration of nitrite nitrogen in the sample
nitrite_nitrogen.title: nitrite_nitrogen

specific_ecosystem.name: specific_ecosystem
specific_ecosystem.description: Specific ecosystems represent specific features of the environment like aphotic zone in an ocean or gastric mucosa within a host digestive system. Specific ecosystem is in position 5/5 in a GOLD path.
comments: Specific ecosystems help to define samples based on very specific characteristics of an environment under the five-level classification system.

zinc.name: zinc
zinc.description: Concentration of zinc in the sample
zinc.title: zinc

investigation field.name: investigation field
investigation field.description: field describing aspect of the investigation/study to which the sample belongs

environment field.name: environment field
environment field.description: field describing environmental aspect of a sample

has_raw_value.name: has_raw_value
has_raw_value.description: The value that was specified for an annotation in raw form, i.e. a string. E.g. "2 cm" or "2-4 cm"

attribute.name: attribute
attribute.description: A attribute of a biosample. Examples: depth, habitat, material. For NMDC, attributes SHOULD be mapped to terms within a MIxS template

id.name: id
id.description: A unique identifier for a thing. Must be either a CURIE shorthand for a URI or a complete URI
notes: abstracted pattern: prefix:typecode-authshoulder-blade(.version)?(_seqsuffix)?
a minimum length of 3 characters is suggested for typecodes, but 1 or 2 characters will be accepted
typecodes must correspond 1:1 to a class in the NMDC schema. this will be checked via per-class id slot usage assertions
minting authority shoulders should probably be enumerated and checked in the pattern

gold_path_field.name: gold_path_field
gold_path_field.description: This is a grouping for any of the gold path fields

has_minimum_numeric_value.name: has_minimum_numeric_value
has_minimum_numeric_value.description: The minimum value part, expressed as number, of the quantity value when the value covers a range.

started_at_time.name: started_at_time
notes: The regex for ISO-8601 format was taken from here: https://www.myintervals.com/blog/2009/05/20/iso-8601-date-validation-that-doesnt-suck/ It may not be complete, but it is good enough for now.

has_numeric_value.name: has_numeric_value
has_numeric_value.description: Links a quantity value to a number

has_maximum_numeric_value.name: has_maximum_numeric_value
has_maximum_numeric_value.description: The maximum value part, expressed as number, of the quantity value when the value covers a range.

ended_at_time.name: ended_at_time
notes: The regex for ISO-8601 format was taken from here: https://www.myintervals.com/blog/2009/05/20/iso-8601-date-validation-that-doesnt-suck/ It may not be complete, but it is good enough for now.

has_unit.name: has_unit
has_unit.description: Links a QuantityValue to a unit

name.name: name
name.description: A human readable label for an entity

SampleData.name: SampleData
SampleData.description: represents data produced by the DataHarmonizer tabs of the submission portal

air particulate matter concentration.name: air particulate matter concentration
air particulate matter concentration.description: Concentration of substances that remain suspended in the air, and comprise mixtures of organic and inorganic substances (PM10 and PM2.5); can report multiple PM's by entering numeric values preceded by name of PM
air particulate matter concentration.title: air_PM_concen

barometric_press.name: barometric_press
barometric_press.description: Force per unit area exerted against a surface by the weight of air above that surface
barometric_press.title: barometric pressure

carb_monoxide.name: carb_monoxide
carb_monoxide.description: Carbon monoxide (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling
carb_monoxide.title: carbon monoxide

humidity.name: humidity
humidity.description: Amount of water vapour in the air, at the time of sampling
humidity.title: humidity

oxygen.name: oxygen
oxygen.description: Oxygen (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling
oxygen.title: oxygen

pollutants.name: pollutants
pollutants.description: Pollutant types and, amount or concentrations measured at the time of sampling; can report multiple pollutants by entering numeric values preceded by name of pollutant
pollutants.title: pollutants

solar_irradiance.name: solar_irradiance
solar_irradiance.description: The amount of solar energy that arrives at a specific area of a surface during a specific time interval
solar_irradiance.title: solar irradiance

ventilation_rate.name: ventilation_rate
ventilation_rate.description: Ventilation rate of the system in the sampled premises
ventilation_rate.title: ventilation rate

volatile_org_comp.name: volatile_org_comp
volatile_org_comp.description: Concentration of carbon-based chemicals that easily evaporate at room temperature; can report multiple volatile organic compounds by entering numeric values preceded by name of compound
volatile_org_comp.title: volatile organic compounds

wind_direction.name: wind_direction
wind_direction.description: Wind direction is the direction from which a wind originates
wind_direction.title: wind direction

wind_speed.name: wind_speed
wind_speed.description: Speed of wind measured at the time of sampling
wind_speed.title: wind speed

alt.name: alt
alt.description: Altitude is a term used to identify heights of objects such as airplanes, space shuttles, rockets, atmospheric balloons and heights of places such as atmospheric layers and clouds. It is used to measure the height of an object which is above the earth's surface. In this context, the altitude measurement is the vertical distance between the earth's surface above sea level and the sampled position in the air
alt.title: altitude

carb_dioxide.name: carb_dioxide

preferred_unit.value: micromole per liter, parts per million

carb_dioxide.description: Carbon dioxide (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling
carb_dioxide.title: carbon dioxide

chem_administration.name: chem_administration
chem_administration.description: List of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. Antibiotics, n fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For chemical entities of biological interest ontology (chebi) (v 163), http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/chebi
chem_administration.title: chemical administration

collection_date.name: collection_date
collection_date.title: collection date
notes: MIxS collection_date accepts (truncated) ISO8601. DH taking arb prec date only
Use modified term (amended definition)

depth.name: depth
depth.description: The vertical distance below local surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectively. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.
depth.title: depth, meters
notes: Use modified term
comments: All depths must be reported in meters. Provide the numerical portion only.

elev.name: elev
elev.description: Elevation of the sampling site is its height above a fixed reference point, most commonly the mean sea level. Elevation is mainly used when referring to points on the earth's surface, while altitude is used for points above the surface, such as an aircraft in flight or a spacecraft in orbit.
elev.title: elevation

env_broad_scale.name: env_broad_scale
env_broad_scale.description: In this field, report which major environmental system your sample or specimen came from. The systems identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. were you in the desert or a rainforest?). We recommend using subclasses of ENVO's biome class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. Format (one term): termLabel [termID], Format (multiple terms): termLabel [termID]|termLabel [termID]|termLabel [termID]. Example: Annotating a water sample from the photic zone in middle of the Atlantic Ocean, consider: oceanic epipelagic zone biome [ENVO:01000033]. Example: Annotating a sample from the Amazon rainforest consider: tropical moist broadleaf forest biome [ENVO:01000228]. If needed, request new terms on the ENVO tracker, identified here: http://www.obofoundry.org/ontology/envo.html
env_broad_scale.title: broad-scale environmental context

env_local_scale.name: env_local_scale
env_local_scale.description: Report the entity or entities which are in the sample or specimen’s local vicinity and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. We recommend using EnvO terms which are of smaller spatial grain than your entry for env_broad_scale. Terms, such as anatomical sites, from other OBO Library ontologies which interoperate with EnvO (e.g. UBERON) are accepted in this field. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.
env_local_scale.title: local environmental context
notes: range changed to enumeration late in makefile, so this is modified (but "sample ID" anyway)

env_medium.name: env_medium
env_medium.description: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).
env_medium.title: environmental medium
notes: range changed to enumeration late in makefile, so this is modified (but "sample ID" anyway)

experimental_factor.name: experimental_factor
experimental_factor.description: Experimental factors are essentially the variable aspects of an experiment design which can be used to describe an experiment, or set of experiments, in an increasingly detailed manner. This field accepts ontology terms from Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO) and/or Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI). For a browser of EFO (v 2.95) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/EFO; for a browser of OBI (v 2018-02-12) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI
experimental_factor.title: experimental factor

geo_loc_name.name: geo_loc_name
geo_loc_name.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea name followed by specific region name. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html), or the GAZ ontology (http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/GAZ)
geo_loc_name.title: geographic location (country and/or sea,region)

lat_lon.name: lat_lon
lat_lon.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude and longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system
lat_lon.title: geographic location (latitude and longitude)

methane.name: methane

preferred_unit.value: micromole per liter, parts per billion, parts per million

methane.description: Methane (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling
methane.title: methane

misc_param.name: misc_param
misc_param.description: Any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here
misc_param.title: miscellaneous parameter

examples.value: Bicarbonate ion concentration;2075 micromole per kilogram

organism_count.name: organism_count

preferred_unit.value: number of cells per cubic meter, number of cells per milliliter, number of cells per cubic centimeter

organism_count.description: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) Should also be provided. (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qpcr)
organism_count.title: organism count

perturbation.name: perturbation

expected_value.value: perturbation type name;perturbation interval and duration

perturbation.description: Type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with perturbation regimen including how many times the perturbation was repeated, how long each perturbation lasted, and the start and end time of the entire perturbation period; can include multiple perturbation types
perturbation.title: perturbation

rel_to_oxygen.name: rel_to_oxygen
rel_to_oxygen.description: Is this organism an aerobe, anaerobe? Please note that aerobic and anaerobic are valid descriptors for microbial environments
rel_to_oxygen.title: relationship to oxygen

salinity.name: salinity
salinity.description: The total concentration of all dissolved salts in a liquid or solid sample. While salinity can be measured by a complete chemical analysis, this method is difficult and time consuming. More often, it is instead derived from the conductivity measurement. This is known as practical salinity. These derivations compare the specific conductance of the sample to a salinity standard such as seawater.
salinity.title: salinity

samp_collec_device.name: samp_collec_device
samp_collec_device.description: The device used to collect an environmental sample. This field accepts terms listed under environmental sampling device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO). This field also accepts terms listed under specimen collection device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0002094).
samp_collec_device.title: sample collection device
comments: Report dimensions and details when applicable

samp_collec_method.title: sample collection method
comments: This can be a citation or description

samp_mat_process.name: samp_mat_process

samp_mat_process.title: sample material processing

samp_size.name: samp_size

samp_size.title: amount or size of sample collected
comments: This refers to the TOTAL amount of sample collected from the experiment. NOT the amount sent to each institution or collected for a specific analysis.

samp_store_dur.name: samp_store_dur

These IDs enable linking to derrived analytes and subsamples. If you have not assigned FAIR identifiers to your samples, you can generate UUIDs (https://www.uuidgenerator.net/).

ecosystem.name: ecosystem
ecosystem.description: An ecosystem is a combination of a physical environment (abiotic factors) and all the organisms (biotic factors) that interact with this environment. Ecosystem is in position 1/5 in a GOLD path.
comments: The abiotic factors play a profound role on the type and composition of organisms in a given environment. The GOLD Ecosystem at the top of the five-level classification system is aimed at capturing the broader environment from which an organism or environmental sample is collected. The three broad groups under Ecosystem are Environmental, Host-associated, and Engineered. They represent samples collected from a natural environment or from another organism or from engineered environments like bioreactors respectively.

ecosystem_category.name: ecosystem_category
ecosystem_category.description: Ecosystem categories represent divisions within the ecosystem based on specific characteristics of the environment from where an organism or sample is isolated. Ecosystem category is in position 2/5 in a GOLD path.
comments: The Environmental ecosystem (for example) is divided into Air, Aquatic and Terrestrial. Ecosystem categories for Host-associated samples can be individual hosts or phyla and for engineered samples it may be manipulated environments like bioreactors, solid waste etc.

ecosystem_subtype.name: ecosystem_subtype
ecosystem_subtype.description: Ecosystem subtypes represent further subdivision of Ecosystem types into more distinct subtypes. Ecosystem subtype is in position 4/5 in a GOLD path.
comments: Ecosystem Type Marine (Environmental -> Aquatic -> Marine) is further divided (for example) into Intertidal zone, Coastal, Pelagic, Intertidal zone etc. in the Ecosystem subtype category.

ecosystem_type.name: ecosystem_type
ecosystem_type.description: Ecosystem types represent things having common characteristics within the Ecosystem Category. These common characteristics based grouping is still broad but specific to the characteristics of a given environment. Ecosystem type is in position 3/5 in a GOLD path.
comments: The Aquatic ecosystem category (for example) may have ecosystem types like Marine or Thermal springs etc. Ecosystem category Air may have Indoor air or Outdoor air as different Ecosystem Types. In the case of Host-associated samples, ecosystem type can represent Respiratory system, Digestive system, Roots etc.

specific_ecosystem.name: specific_ecosystem
specific_ecosystem.description: Specific ecosystems represent specific features of the environment like aphotic zone in an ocean or gastric mucosa within a host digestive system. Specific ecosystem is in position 5/5 in a GOLD path.
comments: Specific ecosystems help to define samples based on very specific characteristics of an environment under the five-level classification system.

env_package.name: env_package
env_package.description: Select the MIxS enviromental package that best describes the environment from which your sample was collected.
env_package.title: environmental package

sample_link.name: sample_link
sample_link.description: A unique identifier to assign parent-child, subsample, or sibling samples. This is relevant when a sample or other material was used to generate the new sample.
sample_link.title: sample linkage
comments: This field allows multiple entries separated by ; (Examples: Soil collected from the field will link with the soil used in an incubation. The soil a plant was grown in links to the plant sample. An original culture sample was transferred to a new vial and generated a new sample)

analysis_type.name: analysis_type
analysis_type.description: Select all the data types associated or available for this biosample
analysis_type.title: analysis/data type

samp_name.name: samp_name
samp_name.description: A local identifier or name that for the material sample collected. Refers to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples.
samp_name.title: sample name
comments: It can have any format, but we suggest that you make it concise, unique and consistent within your lab, and as informative as possible.

source_mat_id.name: source_mat_id
source_mat_id.description: A globally unique identifier assigned to the biological sample.
source_mat_id.title: globally unique ID
notes: The source material IS the Globally Unique ID
comments: Identifiers must be prefixed. Possible FAIR prefixes are IGSNs (http://www.geosamples.org/getigsn), NCBI biosample accession numbers, ARK identifiers (https://arks.org/). These IDs enable linking to derrived analytes and subsamples. If you have not assigned FAIR identifiers to your samples, you can generate UUIDs (https://www.uuidgenerator.net/).

air_temp_regm.name: air_temp_regm
air_temp_regm.description: Information about treatment involving an exposure to varying temperatures; should include the temperature, treatment regimen including how many times the treatment was repeated, how long each treatment lasted, and the start and end time of the entire treatment; can include different temperature regimens
air_temp_regm.title: air temperature regimen

alt.name: alt
alt.description: Altitude is a term used to identify heights of objects such as airplanes, space shuttles, rockets, atmospheric balloons and heights of places such as atmospheric layers and clouds. It is used to measure the height of an object which is above the earth's surface. In this context, the altitude measurement is the vertical distance between the earth's surface above sea level and the sampled position in the air
alt.title: altitude

biotic_regm.name: biotic_regm
biotic_regm.description: Information about treatment(s) involving use of biotic factors, such as bacteria, viruses or fungi.
biotic_regm.title: biotic regimen

For chemical entities of biological interest ontology (chebi) (v 163), http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/chebi

climate_environment.name: climate_environment
